          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "Anyway, simply relying on the script's shebang line is vastly preferable to explicitly writing `bash` or `sh` (or `python` or `perl` or `awk` or `ruby` or...) before each script's file name.\n\nA common shebang line to use in order to make your script more portable is to use `#!/usr/bin/env bash` instead of hard-coding a path to Bash.  That way, `/usr/bin/env` has to exist, but beyond that point, `bash` just needs to be on your `PATH`.  On many systems, `/bin/bash` doesn't exist, and you should use `/usr/local/bin/bash` or some other absolute path; this change avoids having to figure out the details of that."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 5
        }
      },
      "4c818917-01ce-414d-b825-0cd2dac04086": {

            "title": [
              [
                "A common symptom is `: command not found`  where the carriage return has forced the cursor to the beginning of line, overwriting the text before the colon in the error message.\n\nThe script can be fixed using the `dos2unix` program.\n\nAn example use: `dos2unix hello-world.sh`\n\n*`dos2unix` edits the file inline.*"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",

          "parent_id": "a0bf3c69-fab5-4bbc-b3fc-4750019334d4",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["The Bash shell can also be run "],
              ["non-interactively", [["b"]]],
              [
                " from a script, making the shell require no human interaction. Interactive behavior and scripted behavior should be identical – an important design consideration of Unix V7 Bourne shell and transitively Bash. Therefore anything that can be done at the command line can be put in a script file for reuse."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",

          "version": 1
